page.title: 08LAW and ORDER in RHAYADER
page.content: The Police Station in Rhayader has 2 cells for offenders and is only manned for 1.5 hours per week on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays,i.e.1/2hours each day.At all other times Llandrindod Wells (12miles away) has to be contacted for help.There are 3 Policemen and 1 Police Special. The Magistrates' Court "sits" on the first Wednesday of every month with 6 magistrates.They deal with minor offences and pub and club licences.All the more serious cases go to the Crown Court in Welshpool. In contrast to the more urban areas the local policemen are known and accepted as ordinary members of the community. There is very little crime of any sort in the area neither is there any noticeable amount of vandalism.
